reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel location is on the edge of the shore the view is scenic the room are good , property is also good but i love the swimming pool it has the great view look as if ocean is connected to swimming pool only water no land
reviews.title: best swimming pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to the Leela Kempinski Kovalam for my honeymoon. The hotel/resort is sprawling, sitting neatly porched on a cliff.... and with it's own private beach down the cliff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Honeymoon couples who want privacy.

reviews.text: Since I was out for the first time with my newly married wife, I was looking forward to a calm holiday. This resort gave me exactly what I wanted. There was minimal interference from crowd due to the rooms spread across the vast campus. Luckily, my package included breakfast, lunch and dinner, due to which I lived my time here at my own pace.
reviews.title: Soo Pretttyy!

reviews.text: I suggest that one should certainly go for the seafood in their beachside restaurant.
reviews.title: Beauty of Kerala in the lap of luxury
Nice hotel but showing its age
reviews.text: Travelled to the Poover bachwaters, via arrangement with the hotel travel desk. Did the same for a daylong trip to Kanyakumari.

This was my first time staying at a Leela property. I've alway heard good things about them and the few times we've had meals at their Mumbai restaurants have always been a good experience. So it was no surprise that the quality of service was excellent at Kovalam too. The property's location is fantastic. Our rooms were very nice. The service standards really stood out. The quality of the staff is great and one can see there is a great deal of effort put in by the management in this.
reviews.title: Take a bow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is a little small but we thought it was nice enough. The hotel pool was very nice and there was no shortage of towels or smiles from the staff.
reviews.title: The most frustrating 5* hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a quiet holiday this is a very good hotel to have it in.
reviews.title: Excellent stay- can recommend the club rooms

reviews.text: Approaching the Leela up the sweeping drive, it looks really impressive. The huge luxurious reception promises much and, indeed, with very little changes to their operation, this could be an outstanding resort. However, their attention to detail is sadly lacking. We had so many little niggles with them, none of which they managed to sort out despite numerous requests. This place is just so frustrating. It has been designed totally for effect with very little practical consideration. The reception building is huge but there is almost nothing in it. There are no shops or concessions just open space. The rooms are the most bizarre design. On entering the room, you are faced with a washbasin looking down into the bedroom, so very little privacy while washing. Why?. The shower room and toilet are in a separate room, why not the washbasin?. We were in the garden rooms, which sound good until you realise that you are loaded into a golf cart and driven down the far side of the hill, out of the resort, across the road, into another separate resort. You are told that you can get back to the main hotel by phoning for the cart to come and collect you whenever you want. That would have been fine had the telephone worked. So we were faced with a 10 minute trudge back up the very steep hill. The rooms are quite spartan with quarry tiled floors and no rugs, so they feel quite bare. Just as well for one night after a torrential downpour, we returned from dinner to find our room flooded with water pouring down the steps into the bedroom. Rainwater had driven under the door. Talking with the staff who had to come and clear up the mess at 11:00 pm, this obviously happens frequently!. Why don't they just put more effective seals under the doors? The room safe had been left locked by the previous occupants, so we couldn't open it. Neither could they for 2 days. When I insisted that our valuables be put into their safe, the girl stuffed them into a cash box in her desk draw. The air conditioning only worked either flat out, so the room was like a fridge, or not at all which was unbearable. 3 requests but never rectified. Our bathroom supply of toilet paper dwindled away and was never replenished. 2 requests for more, nothing ( we carry an emergency supply). My wife booked an Ayur Vedic massage at the spa, which was way down by the main entrance. When she went to sign for it, she was told that our package included 2 free sessions. That was the first we had heard of it. Indeed, I went back for a session to be told the same. When were the hotel going to tell us. What else could we have had? The garden rooms are close to the private beach so that is some compensation but the sefood restaurant there is also a very strange design. Consisting of 4 cylindrical huts connected by walkways there is no cohesive atmosphere at all, even though the Chinese influenced seafood is quite good. From here, you have no feel that you are staying at the same place as the big building at the top of the hill. The whole place reminded me of the 1960's programme "The Prisoner" with the buggies moving about and the small villas. As though you were never quite sure what was really happening. A real shame because with very little change, this place could warrant the 5* stars it boasts.
reviews.title: Cliftop fablous Resort overlooking the sea..from Gods Own Country

reviews.text: Got upgraded to the club rooms so cant really comment on the other rooms. The club area is separate from the main buidling with its own reception and staff and pool. Rooms were big and well maintained overlooking the arabian sea.
reviews.title: Great Hotel overlooking the Arabian Sea

reviews.text: Hotel located in a nice area of kovalam. Massive hotel. I normally stayed at smaller hotel in kovalam area, so felt like really family type hotel. If you stay at main building, nothing so special. but with children, it could be a nice hotel. for the club room is totally different from main building hotel. really stylish and nice rooms. but somehow, the receptionist at main hotel are nicer........nice things about club room is the swimming pool and view! we had complete seaview from our bedroom. we could also see the sea from the shower room. the food was bit better at main restaurant. and afternoon tea was really small choice. nothing special.
reviews.title: the club room is much better

reviews.text: my friend had 4 hands massage, but one of them are standing while another person was doing massage. she felt very strange, as another person was kind of looking at her.......this is not worse paying more money for two massage therapists.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

reviews.text: the electricity of the both building is not great. we had lots of problem.
reviews.title: They make you truly feel at home !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: food was fine. quite nice. bar area is really nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Stayed at the Leela for 10 days with my Wife and 8 year old daughter. We opted for the Superior beach facing room and this proved to be excellent and rustic in appearance. The room was extremely comfortable and luxuriously fitted out.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better location- but dreadful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Leela for 9 nights in The Club section. The staff were always smiling and keen to provide a good service. Our room was lovely with a small balcony overlooking the Arabian sea. The infinity pool was great and there were lots of sunloungers although the sun terrace did get busier towards the end of our stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with a beautiful setting.

reviews.text: We had breakfast at The Cafe- helpful staff but quite slow service. We hated the crows which would swoop down on any unattended table to steal food and felt more could be done to keep them away. There was no mosquito problem .
reviews.title: My recommendation : there are better hotels

reviews.text: We ate at Lighthouse Beach at several different restaurants.- never had any stomach upsets and also at The Lobster on the other beach near the mosque.
reviews.title: Great place and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a couple of days at this place and thank god it was only 2 days. Inspite of being placed in a sea view superior or whatever that room is, you had to really stretch around to see the sea and then the mold in the bathroom was just fantastic. When I complained it was attended to after 3 calls and I was shifted into a room which was a really small claustrophobic thing and the sea view was much better, I definitely thought we deserved a free upgrade in club suite room or some suite for what I experienced in a so called 5 star hotel. I surely would have been given one in any other place but not in this 5 star hotel of India. So thankfully after a lot of struggle I got out of the place.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!!
